sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Richard Rolle of Hampole, Commentaries on the Psalms, the Canticles and the Nine Lessons of the Office of the Dead (Paruum Job)
Richard Hampole
msDesc.p: Vellum, 226 155 , 8.9 x 6.2, ff. 3 + 168, 39 etc. lines to a page. Cent. xv, clearly written. Initials usually blue with red pen-work.

From Dover Priory: on f. iiiv is:
A. Vo.
Ex dono Willelmi Warren quondam Maioris Douorrie.
It is too late to be in the Catalogue. See Ancient Libraries, p. 523.
On f. iv an erasure: Iste liber.

Various scribbles (xv) on f. iv:
Madaliel.
le cesse mercy paster drotur.
Si quis furetur hunc librum vituperetur
Et condempnetur nisi furti liber habetur.
En se va le munde el no sage beuore ky par la ven cauntera curtesy.
Auez moun cuer en qe e tout moun foy.
Verses. Notes on the Sacrament. (f. iv)

Notes of the signs given to the three Magi (f. iir):
Nota quod Germanus historiographus temporum et teophilus scriptor gestorum Christi tradunt tria miracula facta tribus magis.
See Oscar Schade, Narrationes de vita... B. M. V. etc. Königsberg, 1876 and a MS. in Bishop Cosin's Library at Durham V iv 9.
f. iiiv. Verses on the Sacrament: Constat in altari carnem de pane creari.
f. iiv Note on the Ages of the World, ending: Anno ab incarnacione domini mo cccco quadrag. v.

msItem.head: Richard Rolle of Hampole, Commentary on the Psalms and the Canticles

head.title: Varia opera Latina Richardi Hampole hermitae, viz.

ab.quote:
1. Commentarium in psalterium.
2. In canticum Ysaie, cap. 12.
3. In canticum Ezechie, Ysaie, 38.
4. In canticum I. Reg. 2.
5. In canticum Moisis, Exod. 15.
6. In canticum Abakuk, cap. 3.
7. In canticum Moisis, Deut. 32.

msItem.rubric:
Diuinum flamen opus istud compleat amen.
Assit principio, etc.

ab.supplied: Note: James conflates Nasmith's items 1-7 into a single description

msItem.incipit: Beatus vir. Scilicet christus qui vir dicitur
msItem.ab: The gloss on the Psalter and Cantica ends:
msItem.explicit: misericors erit terre populi sui id est ecclesie que constat ex populo suo
msItem.rubric: Explicit textus psalterii cum glosa secundum Ricardum Ampule heremitam, etc. Deo dicamus gracias
msItem.ab: Ed. Cologne, 1536. See Horstmann, Richard Rolle of Hampole II, p. xxxvii

msItem.head: Richard Rolle of Hampole, Paruum Iob siue Libellus in nouem lectiones mortuorum
msItem.incipit: Parce mihi domine, etc. Exprimitur autem in hiis verbis humane conditionis instabilitas
msItem.explicit: a quo christus nos liberet qui cum patre et spiritum Sanctum regnat in eternum Amen
msItem.rubric: Explicit expositio Ricardi heremite super nouem lectiones mortuorum
msItem.ab: Printed by Rembolt, Paris 1500 and at Cologne in 1536. Horstmann, Richard Rolle of Hampole II, p. xxxvii
msItem.incipit: Latria est honor soli deo debitus

msItem.head: Richard Rolle of Hampole, Commentary on Psalm 20
msItem.rubric: Glosa psalmi vicesimi Ricardi hampol super psalmum vicesimum
msItem.incipit: Domine in virtute tua ... Cum omnes psalmi dulces sunt
msItem.explicit: laudemus in ipso gloriemur in secula seculorum. Amen
msItem.ab: Printed, Cologne 1536. Horstmann, Richard Rolle of Hampole II, p. xxxvii

msItem.head: Richard Rolle of Hampole, Liber de amore Dei contra amatores mundi

head.title: De amore Dei contra amatores mundi

msItem.rubric: Incipit liber de amore dei contra amatores mundi Ricardi hampol
msItem.incipit: Quoniam mundanorum infamia gaudium putat eterni amoris
msItem.explicit: in tua dulcedine te mecum et meis commendo sine fine Amen
msItem.ab: Horstmann, Richard Rolle of Hampole II, p. xxxvii. Other copies are Corpus Christi Oxford 293. Balliol Oxford 224. St John's Oxford 127
